Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Hinky12
Reviews.Content: If I return to San Diego, I would definitely stay in the Holiday Inn Express Downtown again. The employees go the extra 10 miles to make your stay in San Diego pleasurable. Midge is the very visible customer relations agent who not only welcomes you at breakfast and in the lobby, but gets to know the guests and does what she can to ensure the comfort of all the guests. We heard another guest say that Midge brought a cupcake with a birthday candle to their room when she heard there was a birthday to be celebrated there. The front desk receptionists always, (and I really do mean always) had a smile on their faces. They all serve as concierge as well front desk receptionists. No one that I talked to ever had to wait, and the receptionists called cabs, the zoo, restaurants, the bus and trolley line, and museums to help with travel arrangements for us. (Special thanks to Zulya and Martha.) There is a free shuttle (actually the hotel has two) and these will take you to the airport, cruise port, the Amtrak station, the zoo, or Balboa Park anytime you schedule them ahead, and on the spur of the moment if they are free. There are warm, freshly baked cookies in the lobby to welcome guests every evening. There is free wine and beer for two happy hours every afternoon. Every morning they provide a free hot breakfast with pancakes, biscuits and gravy, bananas, cereal, warm cinnamon rolls, pastries, coffee, all kinds of juices, eggs, and bacon or sausage. If you can't take time for breakfast, they give you a "to-go" bag with water, fruit, cookie, and granola bar. The hotel is three blocks away from a San Diego trolley stop. The hotel is an older building, but it is very clean, and the rooms are large. It looked to me like the carpet in the halls was new. I am sure the carpet in our room was new. Most rooms have a private balcony. Our room had a refrigerator, and we didn't even ask, so I assume they are standard. Wi-Fi was free, and worked great! We walked outside late at night (between 11 PM and midnight), and were not afraid in the least (we being two single women). The reasons I didn't give this hotel 5 stars is because it is an older hotel, the bathroom was small, the only sink was in the bathroom, and there is no room service or restaurant in the hotel. We knew no-one in San Diego when we arrived, and had a difficult time selecting a hotel. We really made the right choice by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ammafo
Reviews.Content: I knew from prior reviews of the small bathrooms and slow Internet. The staff went above and beyond my highest expectation. The breakfast was well stocked with both healthy and not-so-healthy choices. The staff constantly kept the place well stocked, with cereals, milks, hard boiled eggs, bananas, yogurt, Danish, bagels, oatmeal, pancakes (fresh from a cool machine), juices, coffee, gravy and biscuits, fresh cinnamon buns. Seriously, I'm not sure what more you can ask for. The staff handed out special candy for st Patrick's day. Cookies after 8p, coffee/lemonade 24/7. Govt workers received free parking, vouchers for downstairs cafe (indigo cafe $10 lunch $15 dinner). Free shuttle to zoo which balboa park and has tons to see and do 10 museums/gardens trails. I tipped the driver the only $1 I had, and he was very grateful. I felt bad giving such a low tip! Our flight was late and they reimbursed up to $15 for a taxi. The front desk dealt with grumpy customers with great skill and tact.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast and confortable rooms, but...”
Reviews.Author: Liacapri
Reviews.Content: the hotel had very low tempreature in the corridors and all common areas. Also, it was under renovation which made us breath some solvents. The staff was very friendly. The location was perfect to go to the best restaurants and club nearby, at walking distance. The beds were very good, room clean and confortable, small bathroom. Breakfast very complete, with eggs, bacon, pankakes, waffels, fruits, yogurt, a selection of breads, juices and the american coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect comfort”
Reviews.Author: JaniceWeir23
Reviews.Content: I stay at Holiday Inns and Holiday Inns Express for most of my out-of-town travel and this spot is at the bottom of the list. The room smelled weird and the A/C was broken. The breakfast was unbelievably bad, even for Free Continental Breakfast items. Next time I am in SD, I might have to venture away from Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is their Best Asset!”
Reviews.Author: TSchenk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here while on a business trip to San Diego. This property was undergoing a renovation while we were there so it should be completed very soon. The staff were extremely friendly and took a deep interest in all their guests. They offer a very nice Manager's reception Monday thru Thursday in the main lounge area. What a pleasant time to spend with the other guests. The hotel manager made several appearances as well, inquiring about her guests stay and making sure everything was to their liking. The hot, complimentary breakfast was also better than most Holiday Inn Express locations I have stayed with. The eating area was large and had plenty of windows that looked out onto the skyline. This property also offered a reliable, complimentary shuttle that would take you to the airport or several other nearby attractions. We found this hotel to be a very good bargain compared to the other properties we considered for our stay. There are plenty of restaurants and grocery stores located in close walking distance from the hotel. We had a mini-refrigerator in our room so we could by some beer and wine locally. The only negative issue we had was with the free internet. I had a good 4 bar signal but the service was very difficult to log onto requiring multiple attempts and once connected it was so slow it was really unusable. I fortunately had my aircard along so we just used that instead. The manager did ask us if we had any problems with our stay during one of the happy hour receptions. We mentioned the slow internet service. She asked if we were on the third floor, which we were, and she said they were aware of the problem and were working on a solution. I noticed one reviewer mentioned the homeless people in the area. This property borders the Gas Lamp district and the entire area has a high population of homeless people. They are not unique to this particular hotel's location. Overall, I would definitely stay here again on a future visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Danna W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is affordable and nice. Not only that but the moment we checked in, we were treated with the upmost repect. The staff was very friendly and courteous. There were beverages by the front desk and the free breakfast cannot be beat! The food and beverages were very good and fresh. Two team members really stood out during our stay, Jeanette and Elizabeth. They were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Going above and beyond to make sure we had what we needed during out stay. I was there recoopering so they made our stay so relaxing and calm. I was very impressed and look forward to staying here in the near future. Will definitely tell my family and friends too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sonic1us
Reviews.Content: We loved it. they had a little store inside that offered food and drinks and other items. They had free coffee and tea by the front desk. They had an small outdoor pool and hot tub. They offered free and it was very reliable shuttle to and from the airport. The free breakfast was amazing. Pancakes, sausage and biscuits, yougurt, cereal and breads along with coffee and juice. The rooms were small but just right. There was a large fridge and microwave and coffee pot. The beds were sooo comfortable. The only bummer was we had to go outside across an enclosed patio to get to the main building. Price was perfect!! We have stayed at nicer hotels but this was the best value!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to see homeless people close up this is the place”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravelerdave
Reviews.Content: This place may have the Holiday Inn Brand on the sign, but it is not Holiday Inn Quality If you walk outside the hotel after 9:00pm you will find homeless people sleeping on the side walk. The rooms are so small you have to close the bathroom door to use the toliet. One of the elevators didn't work. The carpets haven't been cleaned in the halls in a long time. The hotel sits just off the flight path of the San Diego airport, The planes start landing at 5:00am, The best part was listening to the homeless people that were in an alcohol state, signing to the world at 5:00am. This is a motel 6 with a Holiday Inn sign. There a bunch of hotels 5 blocks away that are a better choice

Reviews.Title: “Loud and not good service”
Reviews.Author: K_MckUtah
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at this hotel we were happy with the overall look of the hotel lobby and breakfast room. We really enjoyed the breakfast they had...especially the cinnamon rolls and the pancakes! However, we did not like the location of the hotel and felt that the hallways looked dingy. The guest rooms were nice; however, you can hear a lot of the street sounds, nearby sounds in other guest rooms, and conversations in the hallway. On 2 out of the 3 nights we stayed we were awoken at 1-2 am to people yelling in the hallway. On one night the people also started smoking even though this was a non-smoking hotel. The hotel staff seemed almost non-chalant about the situation. We ended up asking for a refund and staying in another hotel for the next two nights of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the ride”
Reviews.Author: PandM2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel has free shuttle to the attractions and this is a big plus for us since we do not like driving . We missed the shuttle one time and the hotel manager even offered a ride to the train station when he was on his way to the meeting. There is free happy hours which offers free drink and snack and free milk and cookie for the kid at night Do not choose room close to the vending machine since the staff may load the drinks early morning and wake you up Overall, this is a very good hotel and I am very pleased with the service

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place; Glad I found an online discount.”
Reviews.Author: dmpdsc
Reviews.Content: My stay occurred on a weekday between Christmas and New Years. I found an online rate through AAA for about $99 and then called the front desk to see if they'd match it; they looked it up and did so. The walk-in rate was much higher. I was very happy with the cleanliness and the staff of the hotel. Our main activities for the week were in Balboa park so the location was a big plus. I especially liked the free internet-use computers, internet access in my room, and the breakfast. The breakfast included things like cereal, muffins, microwaved scrambled eggs and something I'd never seen before, an automatic pancake-making machine. The breakfast room, however, was a bit smallish - less than 50 - compared to the number of guests. In general, I've rarely encountered a hotel situation where I just HAD to spend over $100 on a hotel to be happy. If I pay over $100, it's because I think I'm going to get something extraordinary. I don't see any evidence that downtown San Diego is any exception. If I go back to downtown SD and can't get Holiday Inn Express for under $100, I'll probably pick someplace cheaper; there are just so many hotels. So I'm glad I had a discount and was happy for the price. That being said, I was irked (although not surprised) to pay $18 to park in their underground parking garage. It irks me because I don't believe they incur anything like $18 in cost for me to park there overnight - maybe $1.80. In my view they are taking advantage of people who wouldn't know where else to park and they amp-this-up by giving you a somber warning at checkout that it's risky to park overnight in downtown open lots, which might be somewhat true. The only reason I tolerated it at all was because it didn't look like the parking garage could hold enough cars for every guest to park there - if parking had been free, I probably wouldn't have gotten a space. I don't mind paying for scarce resources; it's simple supply and demand. But the parking was 50% vacant, which tells me the management team needs to lower the parking price. $9 parking would have made this place "Excellent" for a $99/night price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you're in a bind”
Reviews.Author: Mvated
Reviews.Content: Paid in full for room and checked in after midnight with a front desk agent that said "I was just in the process of cancelling your reservation for good tonight". Too tired to argue I just took the room key and went to sleep. Housekeeping started knocking on doors around 7am and chattering loudly in the hall. Room was decent with an old tv and there was a big balcony. Morning breakfast was ok but uncomfortably packed with people. You can do much better in San Diego for the $$

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: tunsttravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December, staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was very large with everything we needed, decoration was tired but we were here to see the city not spend time in the room. Breakfast was great and staff worked hard to keep everything available at all times. Free freshly baked cookies were in the reception area in the evening which were hard to resist. The hotel has a free shuttle which you can use to get to the zoo, airport and Balboa Park which saves both time and money. We were about a 15 minute walk from the Gaslamp quarter which was perfect and we managed to see most of the city by walking or taking the trolley which was only a couple of blocks away. We certainly did not find this hotel or the guests noisy at anytime. If you are looking for somewhere reasonably priced to stay with great staff, good location and free breakfast, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “a Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: mmaureen
Reviews.Content: We flew from Ontario to San Diego to begin our cruise through the Panama Canal. Wanting to see the city for 4 days before the cruise, we picked the Holiday Inn Exrpess on Seventh Ave. at random... reviews were mixed. At a rate of $69.00/ night (Nov.21-25), we were pleasantly surprised at our good choice. The hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport on time, later drove us to & from Balboa Park, to & from the zoo and delivered us to the cruise ship terminal... all at no charge (except driver tip). This Holiday Inn Express is stategically located, especially if you are a walker (ON HILLS- great exercise though). From the hotel, a one-half hour walk will get you to the Gaslamp District, to the Midway on the waterfront, to Horton's Plaza, to Balboa Park, to the zoo and to Little Italy. The hotel itself is basic but clean; the inside more pleasant than the outside... it's in an older district than the newer, more expensive places nearer to the waterfront. Our only complaint was the small size of the bathroom and the small size of the pillows. The views aren't great but that's not what we were there for. The front desk staffers were always friendly and very helpful with travel info and suggestions. Breakfast was, for this level of hotel, excellent. If you were leaving early, lunch bags with bottled water, apple, granola bar and huge muffin, were available at no charge. A FREE happy hour is available (wine, beer) if you are a member of Priority Club Rewards Club (Holiday Inn loyalty points... sign up at the desk if you're not). In room free wifi worked very well for us. Our neighbours had a shower problem but after one call to the desk, had it fixed in short order. An all-round good choice for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: Guy L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to save a little money on this trip, so booked this hotel. We were very pleased that we did, as the service went above and beyond what we expected for the price! The FREE hot breakfast was awesome, and something you don't get at even the most expensive hotels. Also, the FREE hospitality hour from Monday to Thursday evenings was most enjoyable, and the staff were very liberal with the "refreshments"! We loved having access to the complimentary shuttle, which made trips to the zoo, etc, very easy. The staff we found to be very helpful and professional, and went out of their way to assist us. When we checked in the desk clerk noticed the room we were booked into, and told us it didn't have a very good view. She suggested we take another for that night (queen bed vs. the king we booked), and we would be moved the next day into a much better one. We agreed, and they even threw in a bottle of chardonnay for the "inconvenience". It was our choice, yet they still offered compensation! By the way, we liked the alternate room so much we didn't move the next day! Is this the absolute perfect hotel? If you're looking for a $250 room at $100 prices; no. But if you want a decent place to stay with more amenities than many of the pricier joints, then this suits the bill perfectly! We would definitely stay here again if we visit San Diego in the future!

Reviews.Title: “We suggest you to look for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: USGAB
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™re a Holiday Inn fans, however the Holiday Inn Express Downtown in San Diego didnâ€™t. We donâ€™t recommend this hotel if your visiting San Diego. We got a room with balcony, however there was an annoying noise. After talking to someone front desk (she didnâ€™t have confidence in our observance), she send someone to inspection the room. He realized that the noise was irritating and he dindâ€™t find the source. Consequently we had to change the room (from one corner of the 4th floor to the other corner of the 1st floor at around 11 p.mâ€¦.. you can imagine) You have to pay to park the car 16 $ per night. There arenâ€™t many options in the hotel surroundings. Astonishingly, the garage is public and if you you park directly (without paying to the hotel) the rate is cheaper. The neighborhood looked like dark, empty of people â€¦ We dindâ€™t feel confortable. Also the hotel is at the top of a hill. Also there are not so many restaurants in the area. The hotel restaurant closes early. But there is a Dominos pizza in frontâ€¦ The breakfast is a typical Holiday Inn Express, therefore you can have cereals, juices, pastries, scrambled eggs, yogurts, milk, pancakesâ€¦ a perfect way to start the day. Maybe the breakfast room is small. We would strongly recommend looking for another other hotel in San Diego better situated.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express San Diego Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ALYX_KFB
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a good location for the price. Quite central but about 15 minutes walk to the Gaslight quater. Very nice for business travelers is the Happy hour from 5pm to 6pm as well as that small padeos are available. Breakfast included and helps for business travelers as well. In case of conference participants need to go to the San Diego Congress - this is quite a long walk. Minimum 20 to 30 minutes walk. 1 elevator was not working, so the waiting during my stay was a bit annoying but otherwise fairly ok.

Reviews.Title: “A disaster”
Reviews.Author: MaraInTO
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Express Downtown San Diego in a double double room. It was a disaster. The room is a good size but the bathroom is tiny and we constantly were hitting ourselves on the sink or the door. This hotel seems to be Party Central and I absolutely would not recommend it for families. We booked in November, which is *not* high season, and had to tolerate rowdy guests almost every night. Half the rooms face the pool area - again, lots of noise. Even tho the hotel claims to be non-smoking, guests smoke on the balconies, so the smell of smoke is everywhere and we could not use or open our balcony. Also, the 'party' guests will ensure a long night without sleep. We also had several issues with our room - inc. dirty sheets when we checked in; then, the following day our room was not serviced at all. The cleaning staff work hard but seem overwhelmed. Also, the breakfast is below average. Other reviewers have mentioned the good location - this is true. It's 10 mins. to everything. Also having access to an airport shuttle is very helpful if you have a lot of bags. WIFI signal is strong everywhere in the hotel. There is laundry onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, but poorly maintained.”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful when we booked several rooms for my daughter's wedding across the street at El Cortez (great venue, highly recommended). The only operational elevator was very slow. It was quicker to take the stairs to the third floor. Parking was $16/day in a very cramped lot that was accessible only by elevator. We had a suite with two large rooms, two televisions, one small refrigerator, a poorly functioning coffee maker, a non functional safe, and NO microwave. Our closet space was limited to a small wardrobe that was too short for hanging long dresses. The free wi-fi was slow, 0.9mbps. The bathroom was really tiny. The area for the sink and toilet was less than 5 ft x 5 ft. The electrical outlets were so worn that we could barely use them. Replacements would only cost a few dollars per room. The breakfast food was decent quality and featured an automatic pancake making machine. The trash can had an 8 inch opening for the 10 inch plates. Why not buy better can or at least leave the lid off?

Reviews.Title: “Not special”
Reviews.Author: awesome14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically the borderline average of services, the breakfast is nice, but overall, the the price is too high for a stay here. The location could be better, and the wifi was kind of poor. If you are looking for a fun time in San Diego, I say you go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: dima1976
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I had two rooms for two nights each. The positives first: the staff was great and eager to help. The negatives: everything else, sadly. The wi-fi was on and off (mostly off), only one elevator was working and the wait times were 5+ minutes, the parking garage had very narrow stalls; the room was not refurbished in what seemed to be like decades. This hotel is definitely not in the same caliber as other holiday inn express properties that I stayed in over the years. Until it is remodeled, I would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: Travelfooder
Reviews.Content: Room was great with very comfortable bed. One elevator was out of order making each trip to and from room painfully slow. Carpark was tight fit to navigate small vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful easy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonboboh
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week and could not have asked for a better place. To start the girls at the front desk were so nice and helpful in finding restaurants and giving tips on where to visit. They have a shuttle that will take you practically any place and then pick you up later in the day with very friendly and helpful drivers. The day would begin with fabulous breakfasts with everything fresh, hot or cold. The service there was great-ask for Sabrina she is service with a smile! The rooms were spacious enough and the king size bed was so very comfortable. Our window was large and looked out over the city, spectacular at night and see the sun first thing in the morning-what a way to wake up. Some parts of the hotel were showing wear and tear(it is an older building), but everything was taken care of and very clean. The hotel made for a very enjoyable place to stay in the great city of San Diego and we would go back again and recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: kevinndenise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us and we in turn would like to recommend it to others. We had a very pleasant stay here. I had asked for a quiet room with kingsize bed and that is exactly what we got. We had a corner suite on the 3rd floor with no balcony but it was an extremely generous sized room with 2 small wardrobes, one containing the safe, mini fridge and TV. There was also a comfortable sofa, console table with coffee making facilities and another small table and chair. The room had windows all around which we really liked. The bed was a true king size and very comfortable. The foyer area has 3 computers with internet for free guest usage and a bar area that provides free wine, beer & nibblies between 5.30pm and 7pm monday to thursday. Also there is a stand with free coffee and lemonade. After 8pm free fresh baked cookies too! A free shuttle also takes guests to the airport and local attractions. There is also a swimming pool which we didnt get a chance to use and its close to 2 cafes and a take away pizza place. A short walk takes you down to a trolley terminal and the Gaslamp district and Horeton Mall. Joe on the front desk is the most helpful young man, he is awesome and saved the day for us when another staff member had given us the wrong information on a tour we wanted to do. Definately would recommend this hotel to others and would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for Families attending MCRD Graduations”
Reviews.Author: bsanders_rip
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to combine a week long vacation with the graduation of my nephew from the Marine Corp basic training at MCRD in San Diego. The hotel was located in the perfect location. The hotel not only provided a free shuttle to MCRD, but also the San Diego Zoo, which we took advantage of the day before Family Day began at MCRD. In addition to proximity to the two locations mentioned above, the hotel is locate just about a mile and a half from Old Town San Diego where there are plenty of quality restaurant to visit, not to mention the history of Old Town. We had a rental car and decided to tour the harbor sights. The ride from the hotel to the harbor was only about 20 minutes. The hotel staff, as busy as they were, were alway polite, helpful, and attentive. Should we ever return to San Diego, I would love to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 63RetiredTraveler63
Reviews.Content: From the first greeting at check-in to the good-bye at check-out, the Front Desk was terrific. The staff of the hotel is exceptional, and I would be remiss if I didn't mention the wonderful Sabrina in the breakfast room. This lady has you feeling like Mom just cooked a huge breakfast for you and sends you out to have a great day. BTW, the breakfast is included. The location of the hotel is excellent. It sits atop a hill which affords great views, even though the building is only three stories high. It is between the Gaslamp District and Balboa Park. TIP: If you have any trouble negotiating the very steep sidewalk up to the main entrance, just enter the parking garage on Sixth Ave., and take the the elevator up. The free shuttle service is a tremendous amenity and will take you most anywhere downtown, as well as to the airport. Saves a bundle in cab fees. The hotel is older and the room is a bit dated and small. Not to worry, though. All the modern amenities are there. Free wi-fi, refrigerator, in-room safe. Very clean and comfortable. Bed was just the right firmness for me. You also have both soft and firm pillows. TV not flat-panel, but in San Diego who watches TV with such beautiful weather? You want to be outdoors all the time. ODDITIES: The bar is open only on Mondays and Thursdays. Also, when you call the hotel you have to leave a message, then they return your call. Quite odd, but just not enough of an inconvenience to dwell on. One elevator is out of service, leaving a bit of a wait for the one that is working. If you're fit, taking the stairs is no problem, which I did most of the time. There is a pool and a terrace with a great view of the city. All in all, my 5 nights here was a very nice experience and if I'm in San Diego again I will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: rubysmum58
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights attending a conference. They reimbursed my taxi fare because I arrived from the airport past the time the shuttle was running. The room was immaculate - smelled so clean and the bathroom looked so much nicer than mine at home - no sign of mold or cracks in the grout. Bed was comfortable and it was very quiet for a city. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishWife1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Holiday Inn Express for 3 nights - the location is very convenient to Little Italy and the Gaslamp area (walking distance). Staff is very pleasant. The room was rather "tired" looking, mostly as a result of the stained carpet. We had a room with two double beds, a small refrigerator, a safe (that wasn't operational for 2 days despite repeated calls to the front desk), free wifi and a very tiny bathroom with poor water pressure. Parking is just short of a nightmare - very tight corners and spaces; if you don't use the elevator in the garage, the stairs are NOT well marked. Our stay was during the massive power outage. The hotel had no emergency lighting in the hotel or the garage, no flashlights for guest use, and no bottled water. They did place flashlights in the stairwells. I tested the smoke alarm in our room - it did not work. The stairs in the garage are not marked; that, on top of no lighting, created a dangerous situation. Fortunately, the power came back during the early hours of the morning, but, in my opinion, the hotel should have been prepared ahead of time. Although the staff is very pleasant, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: hgalloway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night as it was close to san diego zoo...the staff was absolutley amazing. It has been a long time since I have found such a friendly hotel that wasn't a 5 star. It is an older hotel but in a great location only a few blocks form the water. we were upgrated to a room with a city view which was lovely. My only complaint(which is small) is that there is only one patio chair on the balcony...it would have been nice to have at least 2 so yu and your significant other could sit out and enjoy the evening and view. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Went the extra mile to accommodate us”
Reviews.Author: Sh0ppergirl
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us who have been friends for a very long time. Came to San Diego to spend time together and enjoy the beautiful city. The ladies at the front desk, Martha, Midge, and Liz, were so friendly and helpful. They always made sure the shuttle could take us where we needed to go and were very helpful with recommendations for restaurants and shopping, etc. We usually go different places for our reunion every year, but may have to come back here next year! They made our stay feel like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with excellent location and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: returnjodi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the first 2 days of our vacation, while we took in the downtown/harbor/Balboa Park sites. The complementary shuttle was so convenient - we didn't even miss having our own car. The front desk staff was some of the most helpful I've ever experienced. They were always cheerful and beyond helpful. They and Steve the shuttle driver really made our stay excellent. As for the hotel itself, it was clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable and the A/C provided a perfect white noise background without being too loud. We didn't heard any other guests or street noise (except a police siren once). The complimentary breakfast was convenient, but the breakfast room was chaotic and didn't seem super clean. I stuck with cereal, juice, and coffee and was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN CONVENIENT DOWNTOWN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for two days on business. The hotel is close to the Courts which was convenient for me. My room was clean and comfortable. The AC worked well and I was able to sleep soundly. I did not use any of the hotels amenities and cannot comment on those. I would describe this hotel as catering to the "no frills" business crowd. A comfortable and convenient place to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: PatySalto
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and friendly staff, the room we stayed in was spacy and clean and we even had a pool view. The bathroom was a little tiny, but that didn't bother us at all. Otherwise , the amenities were of very good quality and the free breakfast was very good for a hotel of this category. The only drawbacks: 1- The carpet in the hallway didn't look nice at all, but I was told that they are about to exchange all of them. 2- The elevator seamed to take for ever to get anywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Centrly Located with access of all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: sonia2302
Reviews.Content: Nice & Cosy Place to Stay in Heart of the City, Downtown where all main Downtown attractions like all resaturants , clubs are on just walking Distance . Main Shopping Destination Hortan Plaza is on just ten min walking Distance from Here. Rooms are very clean with all basic amenties. Staff is very Friendly . Value for money if you want to stay in heart of the town

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall”
Reviews.Author: AMLC
Reviews.Content: Service was impeccable; very friendly and accomodating staff; Provided us with the king rooms with the connecting door as we requested;very clean rooms and bathrooms; cold AC; wonderful to have the free breakfast before you head out for the day's activities; clean pool with complimentary towels; complimentary shuttle to/from the SD Zoo, which we visited; warm cookies and milk at 2000 at the reception desk; will definitely return to this hotel....Thanks for a great stay !!!....from Las Vegas....

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pmax06
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 4 nights in July--- Pros- Excellent views, good location to little italy, gaslamp- We actually walked to both. Great front desk service, nice comp happy hour, free coffe in lobby, lemonade, decent free breakfast- below denny's quality. There is a diner below the hotel w/ good food but pricey. Pool was small but nice. Cons- RestRooms are VERY small. NO counter space, had to use table in the room for staging (perfume, cologne, shampoo, lotions, etc.,). Blow dryer hung over opposite of sink over toilet. Only 1 person getting ready at a time. Parking is tight- We drove an Armada and had to back up quite a few times just to make the turns. Great overall experience as you expect from a Holiday Inn. Would not be 1st choice for a family vacation stay but would consider if last minute. Would definately stay if traveling alone for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place....even better service!!”
Reviews.Author: mbin8910
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location..but it was the amenities and service that makes this our "go to place" in San Diego. Love the patio, a grat place to unwind and visit with our group. Interior lounge is great, the Happy Hour fantastic, super cookies, lemonade and very nice breakfasts every morning! But the service by the staff is second to none ANYWHERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Sebastianes
Reviews.Content: Location is good, near Little Italy and USS Midway Museum and not so far from the convention center. Bedrooms were large. Although I was alone, they accommodated me in a room with 2 couple beds. Bathrooms was OK. Internet in my room worked very well, I could use Skype without problem. There were 2 computers downstairs with a printer which were free to use. Breakfast was average, but they let me change hams, bacon etc for fruits, which I prefer. I did not like the coffee, but they also let me change it for orange juice. Staff was nice with me, and I needed them a lot because I had many purchases to receive in the hotel. I had to pay no charge for this service. There was a free scheduled transfer to Balboa Park and the zoo, which I used and had no problem. A friend of mine, however, said that they did not pick up her in the zoo and after an hour waiting for them she decided to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: megratto
Reviews.Content: Nice location, beautiful view. However, the desk person was very unprofessional. During two conversations with him while trying to switch rooms, he mentioned that we had booked through a 3rd party while rolling his eyes and making his disgust look. The person in front of us was asking for the same thing, he treated her very well, even offered to move her while she went out. He told us that she got that treatment because she didn't book through a third party. He didn't even give us the chance to ask to pay, he just dismissed us as if we were lower life. After those two conversations, he didn't even acknowledge us while passing him. Sorry to be so beneath him. The room had an old musky smell to it, as did the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but....”
Reviews.Author: Wundrwomen
Reviews.Content: There are some things to keep in mind: 1. Although we were prepared to pay for parking (any downtown hotel will have this fee), we were not prepared to see the small parking garage that could not accommodate trucks. The garage is designed to take cars only. You might even have a hard time getting a mid size sedan in/out of the garage. The turns to go up are tight, our truck would not fit. 2. There are may other hidden fees. The charge $3 a day for the safe, even if you don't use it. They have a San Diego travel fee, a CA travel fee, and many other taxes and fees that you donâ€™t expect. 3. The room was relatively clean, except for the carpet. Even though itâ€™s seems vacuumed, it is old and looks gross. The breakfast is good, maybe itâ€™s not IHOP good, but for being complimentary, itâ€™s good. Especially since we had little ones that donâ€™t eat much anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: speechdoctor
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in a good location for visiting San Diego. It wasn't right in the middle of all the action, but the weather is always great for walking to restaurants and attractions (e.g., 15-20 minutes to Balboa Park entrance). The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean. I became a Priority Rewards member to get the upgrades from Holiday Inn, but there didn't seem to be any value to that from this hotel. We were on a couples vacation and had asked for a king-size bed, but we got one with two queens. Even though we were there for 3 nights, they never got back to us (as promised) to try to move us to a king. We didn't get a gift bag or any perk except the happy hour reception (which was a bottle of wine at the bar at 5 pm, no food). The hotel was clean, the view of the city was very nice, and the breakfast was typical Holiday Inn Express, adequate (we always bring our own healthy cereal). The woman who ran the breakfast room was amazing...she zoomed around like crazy making sure everything was perfect, even one day when she didn't have a helper.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: MWG2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 5 Star hotels where the staff wasn't nearly as wonderful as the staff here! Midge, Joe, Alicia...EVERYONE was most accommodating! Every special request we made was fulfilled with a smile. The staff makes this property outstanding. The key to the staff is their "can do attitude." I thought I was staying at a Walt Disney World Resort. The hotel itself is a little old with small elevators and cramped parking...BUT don't let that dissuade you from staying here. The rooms are smaller than most Holiday Inn Express Rooms, but that doesn't matter as the staff is so wonderful you forget about the inconsequential negatives. The location is excellent for going to Balboa Park, The Ships at the Pier, Horton Plaza Shopping and Petco Park. You can get onto 163 in no time at all and travel to all points North quickly. The hotel is 15 minutes from the airport. There is a most delightful little cafe across the street: Cafe de Sol. Have the Tartufo Affogato, it is amazing. (And their Italian Coffee is to die for.) Although there are much nicer properties in the Downtown area, we will stay here whenever we visit San Diego because the staff is so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: arjungupta101
Reviews.Content: Good Location, in downtown. Though location is not Perfect. Its on 7th avenue. I feel 5th avenue would be better as its better connected to rail and buses. But thats only 2 blocks, so not complaining Great Staff. Very Helpful - but keen to sell parking at thier garage. Better to park outside as its cheaper Great Breakfast - delicious cinnamon rolls- best ever had. Sumptuous breads, eggs, bacon, buiscuits and sauce, pancakes. Wonderful juice. Breakfast lady very lively. Makes your day Free hotel shuttle to ferry peir to go to Coronado island. MUST GO THERE. Free hotel shuttle to airport. Free coffee, lemonade and cookies in afternoon/evening. Thus perfect value for money Large rooms, very helpful housekeeping. Only negative point - no bellboy, c'mon its an Express hotel, so not complaining Gave me late checkout till 2pm. Kept my luggage thereafter till evening. Dropped me to airport in thier shuttle. As I said - Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly staff...but a room with totally blocked windows??”
Reviews.Author: hapetravler
Reviews.Content: The gal at the front desk was so nice when we checked in, and then she gave us the keys to a room with ZERO light or view out our small window. The window was totally blocked by the deck dividers from the other rooms. There were probably only two inside corner rooms like this in the hotel, and we were not warned, or braced for being in a black hole. We were shocked that this room would have been assigned to us without any apology or discount. We would not have accepted it if we'd known. The hotel is older and reasonably priced, but the rooms are OK and the staff is very nice, if not forthcoming. In the future we would look for a nicer place and pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, excellent location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: velezmar
Reviews.Content: Last week we visited this hi express, it was by far the best rate we find in downtown san diego. The building itself is kinda old and ugly, but in the inside is very nice, recently renovated. the rooms are spacious, and very clean, the bed very comfortable. The bad is quite small, but if your planning to be outside all day like we do, its not that big a deal. the staff is friendly but nothing overwhelming, the best feature by far, is the breakfast included, with pancakes, cinnammon rolls, eggs, bacon, pastries, coffee, etc. and its location, 2 blocks from trolley 4 from Horton mall and 6 from Gaslamp. You can even go walking to Petco Park! I think that the rate is great for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: southernboytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Diego over Spring Break for a few days and chose the Holiday Inn Express Downtown The Pros +Great location downtown. It's close enough to walk to most things if you want. We had dinner a couple of nights in the Gaslamp area, and it was an easy walk even with the kids. +The hotel shuttle was surprisingly convenient. They will take you to the zoo or the park or the airport. This is a really great perk! +The hotel staff are all genuinely friendly and helpful +The free breakfast in the morning is really good for a free breakfast. +Every evening they have free milk and cookies and during the week, they have a free reception with beer and wine. That's no really expected at this price point or level of hotel, so it's unexpected perk. +We are family of five and we booked two connecting rooms. This was a lot cheaper and a lot more room than we could have afforded at any other hotel around San Diego. The cons -The hotel and its rooms are old. They need new carpet desperately. -The hotel is close to everything but is in more of a residential location, so you have to walk to get to restaurants or shopping. -As others have noted, the parking garage is incredibly tight unless you drive a mini or smart car. I find the $16 a day parking fee to be reasonable for the area, but it's extremely tight and a pain to get your car in or out.

Reviews.Title: “The Little Things”
Reviews.Author: WineDineDive
Reviews.Content: Amazing place! Great rate, and the service is equal to 4 star lodging I've stayed at elsewhere. Even the maintenance men in the hall wishing me a great day. I bought healthy goodies to eat while here, but I arrived to find a nice personalized note, a bag of MnM's and some water as a welcome treat. The healthy goodies stayed in the bag, and I dove into the MnM's. Check in was seamless and everything contained a smile from the moment I walked in until the moment I closed myself in my room...which by the way was completely adequate. King bed, comfy pillows, etc. Could be an an average place with average everything. BUT, these folks care about what they do and my comfort. I'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Dot13
Reviews.Content: We are not luxury hotel people. But this Holiday Inn Express had a lot of extras which made us feel pampered compared to other hotels in this category. We had looked for a hotel with an airport shuttle because we did not want a car for this part of our tript to CA. Not only did the shuttle drive to and from the airport, but also Balboa Park, the zoo, and the harbor front. The hotel had a free happy hour Mon. - Thurs. with 5 or 6 kinds of wine and 2 kinds of beer, and bagged snacks. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best of its kind and we enjoyed the pancake making machine (new to us). We were within a few blocks of the Gaslamp district for great restaurants. The hotel staff was outstandingly friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and quiet, except for airplane noise, which you can hear everywhere downtown - it wasn't too bad. About the only negative thing we could come up with was that the bathroom in the room was small. We would definitely come back to this beautiful city and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful noise ruined sleep”
Reviews.Author: pollypee
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, were checked in very efficiently and liked the very clean but tired looking room. Great view over San Diego rooftops. We used the swimming pool which was heated and a great refuge from the heat of the city. So far, so good. We then went out to enjoy a night in town and returned back at 2200 looking forward to a good night's sleep. That's when the problems started. The room next door was having a party on the balcony and the walls didn't keep out any of the noise. At midnight I marched into reception in my pj's to complain and to be fair on the staff, the noise stopped pretty soon after that. Unfortunately, all through the night we could head drunken people yelling in the corridors and car alarms going off. We ended up having very little sleep. The breakfast the following morning was so meagre in options that I eneded up having none. All in all, a what could be a great cheap little hotel, completely ruined by lack of sound proofing

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Adrew13
Reviews.Content: Close to downtown, ball park, and zoo. Clean and comfortable. Very nice with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomidations, thank you Jeseph Davis!”
Reviews.Author: spankytree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before heading out on a cruise, had some time to kill. Jeseph Davis at the desk helped us out! He told of some great places down the green lantern area. He really made our short stay as memorable as the cruise! Thanks again Jeseph

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Amenities, Attentiveness, & Service”
Reviews.Author: JJTrain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights Jan. 26-29th. 1. Location - Centrally located reasonable walking distance to Gaslamp Quarter, Balboa Park, and the Harbor (no more than 15-20 minutes in any of those directions). Even seeing sporadic, harmless homeless, walks day and night felt perfectly safe. 2. Rooms were fine, except for those on first floor right over the entrance/parking lot (I think it was 125/127), where shining headlights and all-night conversations disturbed sleep. But they moved us after one night, so no complaints. The real gem is their free shuttle service, to & from the airport, the zoo (hence all Balboa Park attractions), and the harbor (officially the cruise terminal, but all harbor cruises are right there). This "gift" eliminates the need for car rental, as long as your destinations are within walking/trolley/bus range, or you don't mind the occasional taxi ride. Also saves the hassle of SD's notorious parking shortage, especially near sites. If free, the shuttle driver will pretty much take you anywhere within reasonable distance, just don't forget to tip (still less than a cab). 3. Breakfast was very good. Assorted egg creations each day, cool pancake machines that look like photocopiers, and an abundance of breads, pastries, fruits, yogurts, dry cereals, and cinnamon buns (yum), and of course, juices & hot beverages. Do breakfast right, and you can probably skip lunch. 4. Service - Front desk staff delightful, attentive, and profoundly helpful in every way. Of special mention, Zulya's enchanting smile when returning from a long day of sightseeing. All in all, great value in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, good location, free breakfast, airport/cruiseport shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: kimo767
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express property is directly across the street from the historic EL CORTEZ Hotel, and is the former hotel annex & banquent rooms of the El Cortez so the rooms are historic, but remodeled and CLEAN! Midge & Zuyla at the front desk were FANTASTIC at checkin and during our entire stay! Jose, maintenance engineer had to play shuttle van driver for entire hotel and the Rodeway Inn across the street. Jose was so cheerful, efficient, PATIENT, and helpful with van service to airport and nearby restaurants. This Holiday Inn Express has free shuttle service to the San Diego Cruise Port, which made me choose to stay at this property over nearby Hilton hotels, even though I am a Hilton HHonors Gold member. I am now a proud Priority Club Gold member convert and am treated with care & respect by Priority Club (take notice Hilton HHonors). Thanks for a great stay! Great mexican food dive tip: POKEZ Mexican Diner on the corner of Tenth Ave & 'E' Street. A real dive, scruffy, grungy, yet friendly atmosphere and staff, but the food is FANTASTIC and cheap! Try the Unsual, Usual "Joey Special", a HUGE plate of delicious green tomatillo marinated boneless chicken, rice, beans, veggies, smothered in green sauce and melted cheese! Steaming side of fresh, hot flour tortillas. Comp chips & salsa, only a buck for seconds. Soda is only a buck, no alcohol. Cash, Visa/MC. We are going back to both!

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: eighmeagh
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from the hotel now. The building is clearly old, but the lobby is bright and modern, and more importantly, the rooms are also bright and spotlessly clean. Staff/service excellent so far. Parking garage is around the corner but the elevators go directly to the lobby, so that's fine. Parking fee is annoying but typical of any city so expected (for those who complain about $16 per day, in Chicago the daily rates are $35 and up, and in San Fran even worse -- not that it makes it less annoying, but ALL cities have parking fees, so to ding this hotel for this isn't quite fair). All in all, it has been a typical HI Express experience to this point. Now for the one huge negative: the windows in my room might as well not exist. The walls don't seem that bad, but in a room on a lower floor fronting 7th Street, the street noise through the windows is unbelievable. Regular traffic is not a problem and not terribly audible, but trucks, buses, etc. are beyond loud. In fact, conversation on the street below is clearly audible in the room. At first I kept checking to see if the windows were closed, then I opened them myself to confirm that it actually it just as loud whether they are closed or open. There have been several busloads of teenagers loading into school buses during the early evening hours, and the buses idling outside pre-loading and then the noise of the loading has sent me running for headache medicine. Even though the hotel itself is fine, location is good/convenient for the purpose of my trip to SD, price is in line with other hotels of this class, etc. the street noise would be a deal breaker for me for future stays, as I'm hypersensitive to that sort of thing. A higher floor room facing west to 6th Street might be fine though.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: DreamsTapatio
Reviews.Content: After a long car trip, from Hermosillo Mexico, to San Diego, Ca, arrive to this hotel was a refresihng experience, the staff couldnt be more gentile, always with a smile in their face. the rooms were clean and comfortables. The location was very good, close to downtown shops and gaslamp district. The breaksfast was good with hot and cold options, and again a smiley staff. free high speed internet always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “What it lacks it makes up for with a GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: Cindy-Milford
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was nice here. The hotel is obviously old and has been remodeled. The room is rather modest in size, with 2 double beds a small table and 2 chairs another chair and a bureau that contained the TV and a mini-refrigerator along with 3 drawers. The closet was open style behind the entry door to the room. There is an iron and ironing board provided in the room and hairdryer in the bathroom. There is also a small coffee maker. We were on the 3rd floor and had sliding glass doors that led out to a balcony with a plastic chair and a view of downtown/waterfront, all-be-it a mostly obstructed view of the waterfront. The bathroom was a very tight squeeze. 2 People do not fit in here, one barely fits in the room. The toilet looks like one from the old school days. Enough said the bathroom was SMALL, but the linens were nice. Housekeeping does a great job. Our biggest issue was noise levels were REALLY bad in the rooms especially on the weekend. It appears to be a popular hotel for families/soccer teams/college kids, all of whom were noisy into the wee am hours and sometimes even drunk and shouting in the hallways at 2:30AM, hotels are for sleeping and rest not partying and personally I think "guests" such as these should be asked to leave the hotel. This was the biggest problem on weekends, weekdays were fine, mostly business travelers, quiet rooms and hallways. Weeknights there is a wine/snack hosting in the lobby for about 2 hours, that is a nice touch for business travelers. Breakfast is below the lobby on level M1 and consists of a typical hotel breakfast, eggs (scrambled some days, microwave omelets others), bagels and muffins, toast, juices, coffee, cereals, and some days pancakes. Basic but sufficient. We had lunch at the new orleans style restaurant down below one afternoon and it was very good. Many thanks to Midge, who makes you feel as if you are right at a friends house. She and the staff helped make this trip enjoyable. The hotel is only 3 blocks (about a 5 minute) walk from the Orange Line which can take you down to the convention center or the waterfront just a few stops away. It is also only about 5 blocks from the Mall downtown. San Diego is an easy city to get around in and the location of this hotel is good for the price you pay. I would definitely recommend this hotel for budget minded business travelers on weeknights Sunday-Thursday, but avoid it on Friday and Saturday nights as you cannot get away from the noise and rude behaviour of other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff from the room staff to the great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Blair55
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days and found the hotel to be older but very well kept. The hotel is only blocks (easy walk) from the Gaslamp area but without all the traffic. It is also a very easy walk to Balboa Park and the San Diego Zoo, barely a need for a car. I must also say that the staff were very friendly and seemed interested in where we were from and going on to. Since we were from Canada, they asked lots of questions. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk people where great”
Reviews.Author: Bob0931
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The best part was that you had the convience of the shuttle service. the holiday inn nearer to the bay is 2x the the cost of this inn. I do not think my wife and I would have enjoyed being there verses the cost..

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: flyage
Reviews.Content: We stay in hotels around the world, for the price, this hotel was pleasantly adequate. Very nice staff, clean room, amenities: decent breakfast, hosted wine/beer hour, cookies/milk @ 8pm, newspaper, airport/cruise shuttle, located near shopping plaza. Another star should be added.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: AGDun
Reviews.Content: Nice, spacious and clean rooms. Great location. Good customer service. Breakfast was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: sadie155Denton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay here and found very little to complain about. It has spacious rooms, is very clean and beds were very comfy. There is no need for a car at this hotel if you are staying around town. It is a short walk to the Gaslamp district and public transportation is at most, a block or two if you want to get just about anywhere. They also have a free shuttle to the airport and nearby attractions. We used it once to get to the harbor but walked back. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast buffet was more than adequate and very good. The only complaint I have, and it is minor, is that all of the electrical outlets in the room were old and my chargers for my phone and laptop would not stay in. I had to plug it in to the bathroom outlet on the sink. There is free wifi in the room but I kept losing the connection. I told the front desk upon checkout and the man told me I could have requested a cable for ethernet. I now know that for next time and will definitely be staying here again. I booked this room from Expedia and it was definitely a great value for the money. San Diego is an awesome city with so much to do and very friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Baygirl23
Reviews.Content: Parking is in a garage around the corner, and if you drive anything bigger than a mini Cooper, beware. This garage is NOT made for normal sized vehicles with its tight turns and small spaces. Plus, you have to pay to park per day...which SHOULD be included in the cost of the room. TV didn't work when we arrived and had to wait until the next day for it to be looked at and fixed. Only positive remarks: breakfast was good and the bed was comfortable. Driving around through the city, there are many other places to stay with a much better view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, very clean older budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShiftyNJ
Reviews.Content: Friends and I occupied two rooms here recently while attending a large event. They had used the same hotel before due to its proximity to our intended location. They told me in advance that it was nothing to write the parents about, but perfectly adequate for a few days' stay. We are both members of IHC's loyalty program and thus have seen a number of Holiday Inn properties and knew what to expect. I arrived on their complimentary shuttle from the airport and was given access to my room despite it being a few hours prior to the normal 3pm check-in. LAYOUT Doing some homework I discovered this property has a storied past. It was built as an annex to the historic 1920s El Cortez Hotel, and at one time the world's first moving sidewalk connected the two properties on a span over 7th Avenue. This hotel is perched on the side of a steep hill, so that the entrance on one side is about five stories higher than on the other. A parking deck, two restaurants, conference rooms, offices, stores and a church fill the space under the hotel. Parking is included for guests, but drive carefully in the garage because the columns are very close together and battle-scarred from people scraping them. A glass elevator on the low side connects the lobby level to the street. The lobby faces San Diego Bay although the view is punctuated by tall buildings closer to the water. This can be enjoyed both from the lobby lounge where IHC members are treated to happy hour during the week, and an adjacent terrace, partially covered, with tables for guests to relax, eat or smoke. Across the driveway is an outdoor pool and terrace with chairs and tables (but alas no umbrellas) all of which were kept scrupulously clean. The lobby floor and two levels above it contain the guest rooms. There are two elevators which are used not only for the hotel but the parking deck below it, and they are painfully slow so we mostly walked. ROOMS My room was a king ordinary facing the street. The furniture was all in good repair and a laptop-capable safe and empty fridge (vs. a minibar) were welcome discoveries. Wireless Internet is available and included. The bathrooms are very small (there's a bumper on the door to keep it from smacking the toilet) but nicely renovated and everything was spotlessly clean and in working order. Beds are comfortable with a variety of pillows (labeled for your firmness preference). My friends' room was a two-queen with a large terrace facing the pool and driveway area. Otherwise very similar in amenities. We both noticed that the air conditioners, while new-looking, struggled to keep the rooms cool. If having a view or a lot of daylight is important to you, make sure you mention this when you arrive. On either end of the hotel there are a handful of rooms whose windows face a wall only about 3-5 feet away... not for the claustrophobic! FOOD There is no full service restaurant owned by the hotel. However, in the building (accessible by the outdoor elevator mentioned above) on the 6th Ave side is a little place called the Indigo Cafe which serves a variety of food (including breakfast at any time), has a liquor license, and is open until 9pm most days. Free breakfast was available in the conference area below the lobby, and was well-stocked and fresh if not overwhelming in variety. Hot and cold cereals, scrambled eggs, cold hard-cooked eggs, bread, muffins, pastries, bananas, oranges, apples, etc. were daily staples. Most days we were there they also had biscuits and sausage gravy, and on the last day this was replaced by bacon. The hot cinnamon rolls were a big hit with someone in our party. Given the chaos we encountered at the last Holiday Inn breakfast (Eatontown, NJ http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g46868-d98139-r70561651-Holiday_Inn_Tinton_Falls_Eatontown-Tinton_Falls_New_Jersey.html) it was well-run and we were very satisfied. None of us could stomach the coffee but others seemed to be enjoying it so maybe we're just java snobs. We found good stuff at the Cortez across 7th Ave. DRINK IHC loyalty club members are invited to a happy hour in the lobby on weekday afternoons. Otherwise there is no bar owned by hotel. The aforementioned Indigo Cafe has a liquor license, however, as does the Cortez cafe across the street. SERVICE Everyone there was very friendly and helpful. The entire property is kept very clean and the staff were quick to help with any need. SUMMARY This is a budget hotel in an older building, but the management is doing a very good job keeping it clean, attractive and comfortable. Services are limited but in line with the Express marque and what they offer, they do well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - good location”
Reviews.Author: NRRobinson
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money. Excellent price, and a great location (near the zoo and at walking distance to the gaslamp district). Nice and clean room (very confortable beeding), free WI-FI and free breakfast. The staff at check-in was very friendly. As member of the priority club, they gave us glass of wine/beer during the happy hour. However the parking was very expensive and dark !!! The elevators are very, very slow. If you get a chance visit the

Reviews.Title: “Good place... BUT BE CAREFUL WITH YOUR BELONGINGS...”
Reviews.Author: sandeepai
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as a part of my US trip. THe front desk was very helpful with the local tours and transportation which was great for us as we were travelling with a young child. But thats where the buck stops. On the second day of our stay there we return to our room in the evening to discover that my mobile has been STOLEN...on contacting the front desk the response was a very casual " contact lost and found tomorrow' The next day the manager called us up and apologised about our loss...by then we felt violated and apprehensive about the rest of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: franciscob
Reviews.Content: Clean, in downtown, breakfast is good, Not the best, but not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: yburnside
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before a cruise. Arrived on a Thursday so we enjoyed their happy hour. Not the finest wine and beer but it was free so it served the purpose. Front desk staff were very friendly and willing to help us arrange transportation in their free shuttle. The shuttle staff were super nice too. My husband uses a cane and they were always so patient. The breakfast was more than enough to set us off for the day.We only paid $73. US a night so I feel that we got very good value for the money. We had dinner in the restaurant below the hotel and enjoyed the food.. Nothing was fancy at the restaurant or hotel but we did get good value. People in San Diego are very kind and friendly. Wish we had more time to spend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but this hotel has many issues.”
Reviews.Author: Askrade
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good things first. This hotel is about 4-5 blocks from the Gaslamp district. It's very close to Balboa park and the zoo. They have a decent breakfast that comes with your stay and a 5pm happy hour with free beer, wine and soft drinks in their lobby. Their lobby is a very lovely space with a wonderful view of the city and the breakfast area had ample seating for guests at the hotel. The rooms have wonderful views as well. Now on to the negative part of the experience. We arrived at the hotel around 4pm on a Tuesday. We were told our room hadn't been cleaned yet and we would have to wait for it to be ready. It turned out to be well over an hour, spent sitting in the lobby waiting, after having driven for five hours. Next I was told by the uninterested staff member at the front desk that the room only had two double beds (no sofa bed, as their website would lead you to believe) and roll aways were not an option because the rooms were too small. We were traveling as a family of four with two teenagers, a boy and a girl. I had chosen this hotel thinking we had three beds in the room. The kids sleeping together was not an option. The hotel staff suggested one of us sleep on the floor with a blanket and pillow. We were to be staying for three nights. I thought this was an unacceptable suggestion. After this conversation with the staff, my husband and I sat in the lobby discussing the possibility of finding a new hotel. At this point the manager came over and offered to put us in a suite the next day at no extra charge, but the stipulation was we had to make sure we were at the front desk first thing in the morning to make sure we got the room, as soon as the current guests checked out. Not sure why they couldn't just hold the room for us. The first night had to be spent in the overly small room with our son sleeping on the floor, in lieu of sleeping with his father or sister. The next day we were at the front desk at 8:30am, with our bags all ready to check out of the small room into the suite. The hotel held our bags for us while we were out site seeing. After being out all day, we arrived back at the hotel about 4:30pm. The room was not cleaned yet. I was told their computer was down, which apparently affects their cleaning schedule. They told us we could put our bags in the room, even though it was not ready. The manager warned us there was a rip in the sofa bed in our suite. We went up to our room which looked like someone had been having a party in it the night before. The sofa bed had a large rip in it, as the manager had said, and had a sunken spot in the middle, which you would roll in while sleeping. The room had burn holes and black stains all over the carpet. There was a dent in the ceiling above the bed (which looked like someone had hit their head while jumping on the bed). Our lamp was plugged in to a very scary looking crazily rigged extension cord taped under the carpet. The suite was a handicapped accessible room which meant it had no tub and an odd shower. This was fine, but I would think it's something the hotel might mention when checking you in. The room was better than our small one, in the sense that we all had our own bed and a lot more space, but it was the most run down suite I've ever been in. The next day, once again we were gone all day and came back in the evening and the room hadn't been cleaned. We had to mention it to the maid, who then cleaned the room for us at about 6pm. Computers down again? The pool is very tiny and 3ft at it's deepest spot. It's also fenced in and was locked up most of the time we were there. Their hotel parking ramp is the tightest I've ever seen. Very challenging to get in and out of. Good luck with a large car. We enjoyed our stay in San Diego, and the hotel did mostly make it right for us, but I would never stay there again. In fact I'm going to avoid all Holiday Inn Express hotels from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: lkm55
Reviews.Content: I spend 150 nights a year in Holiday Inn Express and am very loyal to the chain. I was disappointed in this location. It's an older hotel, but in good repair. The room was comfortable, the bathroom was tiny. The service was mediocre at best. When I returned to the room the second the bed was made and towels were changed but that was it. Neither the glasses, coffee cups, nor coffee was replaced. Nothing like getting dressed and going to the front desk for a clean glass at nine PM. The parking garage is around the block and tiny. If you're driving anything bigger than a compact car I would stay somewhere else. With a full size pickup I had to stop, back up, and re-align around every corner. Parking for hotel guests is on the third and fourth floors only. If you're flying in and don't have a car it probably would be a better deal. And, parking is $16.00 per day, this is not noted on the website. This was an unusually bad experience from what is typically a four star chain.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: Doombugy
Reviews.Content: We booked and pre-paid for our 1 night stay. Our rate was $69. The room was ok but the bathroom was tiny....only SLIGHTLY bigger than an airplane restroom. Ok for one night but wouldn't stay any longer. Parking is a pain and the area for registration parking was bizarrely configured.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Waterrecycle
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very average and some of the clientele look a bit dodgy but I am very happy with my stay. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and it was quiet. Slept great. The breakfast is fine and the service was satisfactory. The hotel is a little out of the way but quite accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: rezzetto
Reviews.Content: Lobby is the best part of this hotel, rooms are pretty beat up and dirty, my room had some gnats flying around, carpet was filthy and there was hair in the shower. Good location but be careful walking back to the hotel via Ash St at night, lots of hobo's along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Kodester
Reviews.Content: We recently visited family in San Diego and spent two weeks at this hotel. The entire experience was very enjoyable in every regard. Management and staff were very accommodating and went to great lengths to make us feel right at home. They also have a great breakfast! We plan to repeat our trip next year and will MOST certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: goineverywhere
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price. The staff was really helpful, they gave us a lot of info and shuttled us practically anywhere we wanted to go within reasonable distance. The breakfast was ok. The rooms were clean. There was an old musty smell but other than that it was fine. If you want to save money and still be close to downtown it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the visit”
Reviews.Author: smollie29
Reviews.Content: Everybody was very friendly and helpful inculding the shuttle driver. Clean, comfortable and the breakfast they serve is tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the night before a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Downtown48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a Christmas cruise out of San Diego. Couldn't have asked for much more. They picked us up from the airport and took us to the boat the next morning for free! They have a very nice continental breakfast bar in the morning that actually includes some hot items as well. There was a drug store within walking distance for any last minute items you might need. I would stay here again before a cruise if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff but rundown hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTr88
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel without any of our bags (thanks to United Airlines and the sudden new policy from the FAA that prohibited any carry on luggage), the two front desk night clerks, Midge and Elizabeth were simply wonderful. They were cheerful and funny and equipped us with almost everything - toothbrushes, toothpaste, mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, deodorant, bath gel, shower cap, makeup cleaning cloth - we needed to get through the night without any of our personal items. The only thing missing was clean underwear, socks and PJs! We stayed twice at the Holiday Inn. The first time was 5 nights before our cruise. The second time two night after the cruise. These are the positives and negatives of the hotel: POSITIVES: 1. Great front desk staff 2. Good size rooms and bathrooms 3. Good hot breakfast 4. Shuttle is quite good with friendly drivers but will only take you a radius of one mile from the hotel. You also have to make an appointment the day before you need to use it but once they take you to a place, you can call them for pickup same day. 5. Nice pool 6. Walking distance to shops and close to pier 7. When we returned to the hotel after our cruise, it was 10:30 AM. They got us a room right away without waiting at all and that was terrific. NEGATIVES: 1. There were problems with both rooms that we stayed in. The first room was a handicapped accessible room (we didn't ask for one) and the shower head kept rolling down the rail. The maintenance guy could not fix it. He said they didn't have the parts for it. On our second stay, the faucet was leaking really badly and the mirrored door of the closet fell off the hinges as soon as I pushed it! So the repairman came up and we waited for him to fix them. We think the hotel should have checked those things before guests moved in. 2. The beds were uncomfortable and we suffered painful backs after sleeping in them for a few nights. 3. The hotel looks old and rather rundown. 4. The maids were very unreliable. We'd put our sign to make the room hanging on the doorknob all day and come back at 4 PM to find the room unmade. We would then call the front desk and the maid would knock on the door at 4:30 PM when we wanted to have a nap and she had ALL DAY to clean our room. After that experience, we called down to the front desk every time we were about to leave the hotel to tell them to have our rooms made up and we'd return to find the rooms unmade and we'd have to call again and again. The maids can barely speak English so when we tried to talk to them, we basically got nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NorthWoodsWanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention. Very friendly and helpful staff. Free shuttle to/from airport. Free breakfast that is decent by inexpensive hotel standards - always had some form of eggs along with fruit, cereal, pastries, warm mini-cinnamon rolls (tasty), sausage or biscuits and gravy, juice, coffee, etc. Room was clean and well-equipped. Bathroom small as others have noted, but clean and fine with a nice showerhead and good, fluffy towels. Additional perks here are warm cookies at night, and a free happy hour with wine, beer, or soft drinks and snacks on weekdays. Free internet worked fine. Conference rate of $89/nt. made this a great value. Wish it had a fitness center. There is a small pool. Only other down side for those needing to go to the convention center area daily is that it is a bit of a hike. But the upside is that you are in San Diego and it is almost always a very nice walk.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say?”
Reviews.Author: percsSurreyBC
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left 10 days later, the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and at home.The front desk staff were exceptional, whether it was giving us a much nicer room on the first day, arranging for the FREE shuttle to transport us around the town, or just the bright morning greeting whenever you went down for the free cooked breakfast. Talking of breakfasts , what a great way to start the day, cereal,yoghurt,bacon, eggs, sausage, muffins,toast, cinnamom rolls. scones and gravy, fresh fruit, etc etc etc. The housekeeping staff did a super job and it was so refreshing to listen to the beautiful singing of one of the staff as she cleaned the rooms. You MUST visit the Indigo restaurant on the ground floor !
